This painting is probably Philip Dunwich's.
It's a portrait of Philip Dunwich.
It's probably him in his mid-thirties. For the portrait of a man who succeeded as a merchant and made an enormous fortune, he looks surprisingly young.
His sharp, high aquiline nose and sturdy-looking jaw spoke of Philip's strong-willed, stubborn nature, and his narrow, piercing eyes seemed to prove he belonged to a dangerous world.
If you're always boarding ships as a trader, it's never simple-you've got to play psychological games with trading partners and keep rough sailors in line and so on.
